abstracts.cdata!:
The overall project development
            objective (PDO) of the Livestock Waste Management in East
            Asia Project is to reduce the major negative environmental
            and health impacts of rapidly increasing concentrated
            livestock production on the open waters and thus on the
            people of East Asia. Its global environment objective is to
            reduce livestock-induced, land-based pollution and
            environmental degradation of the South China Sea. The
            closing date of this project will be extended by six months
            from December 31, 2010 to June 30, 2011 to allow Vietnam to
            complete all activities satisfactorily. Implementation
            delays were caused by the following main factors such as: 1)
            lack of experience of the Project Management Office (PMO) in
            early years of project implementation; 2) change of project
            area and relocation of project farms in Dong Nai province;
            3) restructuring of Ministry of Natural Resources and the
            Environment (MONRE) in 2008 inactivated the PMO for more
            than six months; 4) delay in provision of the committed
            government funding; and 5) delay in construction of
            livestock waste management facilities due to serious storms
            in 2009 and 2010.
